desc: Around midnight on August 14th, an officer confronts a journalist standing on the sidewalk. The officer repeatedly shoves the journalist, striking their phone at one point.

title: Officer stomps on protester trapped under shield
desc: After police charge the protester shield line, an officer stomps on a protester trapped under their shield.

title: Police charge at and beat protesters with shields
desc: Protesters and police stand off in the streets. Protesters have formed a line of wooden shields. Police charge at the line, striking protesters with batons. A drummer is tackled to the ground and beaten with batons.

title: Officer stomps on protester trapped under shield
Officer tackles multiple protesters
desc: While dispersing protesters, an officer tackles two protesters and the filmer, a journalist, all of whom are standing on the sidewalk

title: Police charge, pepper spray, and tackle protesters
desc: Police charge at protesters, pepper spraying indiscriminately. One protester is also tackled to the ground.

title: Officer shoves protester on the sidewalk
Journalist struck with tear gas canister and impact munitions
Pro-life protesters arrested for chalking sidewalk
desc: Pro-Life protesters held a permitted protest outside a D.C. area Planned Parenthood building. Several were arrested for vandalism after attempting to paint and chalk messages on the public sidewalk. The Metropolitan Police Department states that although the rally was permitted, they state a Department of Transportation permit would also have been needed to chalk on the sidewalk. A spokesperson for the protesters states that protesters were told they would not be phyiscally stopped from painting and were even advised on what paint to buy.

title: Police shove and pepper spray protesters
Police beat and pepper spray protesters during violent arrests
Police pepper spray protester
Member of the press pepper sprayed
desc: A member of the press stands in a crowd of protesters, shining a bright light in the direction of officers as they are documenting. An officer pepper sprays this individual.

title: Police shove members of the press during arrests
Woman arrested and pepper sprayed after yelling at police
desc: Footage shows a woman yelling at police in the street. After about a minute, police tell her to get off the street, then arrest her. While she is being held down, another officer pepper sprays her.

title: Officers shove press during dispersal order
desc: Press and protesters pepper sprayed and shoved while trying to follow orders to move backward.

title: Officers shove press during dispersal order
Police violently push, shove, and arrest protesters
desc: At protests honoring the 6th anniversary of Mike Brown's death, police charged at protesters, pushing them from one side of the street to another. Police discharged pepper spray en masse and tackled numerous protesters to make arrests. One protester is seen helping another over a short fence; an officer grabs this protester by the backpack and hurls them to the ground. The officer continues to yank the backpack. The protester slips off the backpack and runs away.

title: Journalist shoved by police
desc: A group of press and legal observers are gathered on the sidewalk. Police direct them into the street to the other side. The group begins to obey. Officers shoves the filmer, a journalist, from behind.

title: Individual held on the ground, pepper sprayed, punched, and arrested
Police throw explosives at crowd as they drive away
Bystander shot in the head
BLM Organizer hospitalized after officer kneels on her neck
Officer shoves protester on the sidewalk
desc: A protester steps off the sidewalk and an officer approaches, shouting, "Move." The protester immediately steps back on the sidewalk. The officer then shoves the protester.

title: Police repeatedly shove drummer
desc: A drummer walks toward police. An officer shoves the drummer. The drummer then turns around, walking the direction police stated. The officer shoves them again.

title: Officer shoves stumbling protester
Officer shoves reporter
Officer shoves press
desc: Footage shows a sergeant in the Dekalb County PD backing a member of the press up along the sidewalk. The member of the press is complying with orders. The officer is moving much more quickly than the rest of the line, shoving the journalist with his shield.

title: Police pepper spray fleeing protesters
desc: Footage shows protesters moving away from police at North Michigan Avenue and East Wacker Drive. Officer discharge pepper spray at them.

title: White-shirted officer shoves his way through a crowd of protesters
Police officer rips mask off protester, shoves reporter
Police shove protesters with bikes
Police shove protester from behind
desc: Footage shows a protester holding a sign above their head and walking slowly away from police. An officer runs up in the protester's blind spot and shoves the protester to the ground.

title: Police shove protesters and confiscate guitar
desc: Police shove protesters on the sidewalk. One officer grabs a protester's guitar and walks away with it. The protester chases the officer and is shoved and shot at.

title: Police throw stun grenade at retreating protesters
Police puncture Snack Van's tires
desc: The Snack Van, which offers free snacks, water and medical supplies to protesters, joined protests on August 18th and drove slowly along side protesters following dispersal order. Officers punctured the van's tires.

title: Police shove videographer
Police respond to thrown water bottles with impact munitions
desc: After protesters throw water bottles at federal officers, at a protest outside an ICE facility, officers respond by firing a sustained barrage of impact munitions, allegedly including pepper balls.

title: Police shove protesters following directions
Police slash tires of bystander vehicle
desc: A bystander in a vehicle with a Black Lives Matter sign pulled off to the side of the road to allow police vehicles to pass by. An officer then slashed the vehicles tires.

title: White-shirted officer shoves his way through a crowd of protesters
desc: Footage shows police and protesters facing off at North Michigan Avenue and East Wacker Drive. An officer in a white shirt, indicating higher rank, shoves his way into the crowd of protesters. Additional footage shows other officers shoving protesters as well.

title: Police shove press on the sidewalk
Police on bicycles chase down and beat alleged protester
Police tackle protester, confiscate shield, then pepper spray her
Officer shoves protester on the sidewalk
desc: A PPB officer shoves a protester, yelling, "Get on the sidewalk." After the protester is on the sidewalk, the officer shoves the protester to the ground and trains his gun on the protester.

title: Police respond to thrown water bottles with impact munitions
Police pepper spray protesters as they push protest into park
Federal officers shoot at and tear gas protesters
desc:
Federal officers push protesters back from an ICE facility, firing impact munitions and deploying tear gas. A handful of protesters had been banging on the walls of the building, but no further vandalism had been committed up to that point.

Officers then retreat temporarily, before later emerging to push protesters back again.

title: Police shove and pepper spray RNC protesters
desc: At a protest outside the Republican National Convention in Charlotte, NC, police used bikes to shove protesters and pepper sprayed others. A journalist filming the scene was caught in the pepper spray.

title: Police snatch, kneel on, and arrest individual
Police officer tackles protester
desc: While police push protesters down the street, several can be seen milling about further back on the sidewalk. An officer breaks from the line and charges at a protester, tackling them from behind.

title: Officers shove protesters and legal observer
desc: Around midnight on August 22nd, police gave conflicting orders to protesters regarding the direction to go. Protesters stopped, confused. Police then shoved protesters around, striking one with a baton. A representative from the National Lawyer's Guild was also knocked to the ground.

title: Police officer strikes journalist who insults him
Police arrest protester without warning or clear justification
desc: Police talk to a protester walking by their line. The protester steps forward and is held back by police. The protester then talks to another officer. That officer then grabs the protester without warning and arrests them.

title: Officers shove and pepper spray protesters on sidewalk
Homeless bystander caught in tear gas
desc: A homeless bystander sleeping on the street is caught in tear gas. Protesters wake him up and get him out of the area.

title: Officer bludgeons protester with pepper spray can, then sprays crowd
desc:
A police officer following retreating protesters can be seen repeatedly striking a woman with his pepper spray can. He then discharges pepper spray on the crowd.

A woman claiming to be the victim alleges her right wrist was broken in the incident.

title: Police throw stun grenades and tear gas canisters from rooftop
desc: After protesters set an awning on fire, police emerged to extinguish the fire. Police threw stun grenades and tear gas at a handful of protesters standing around below.

title: Police throw stun grenades and tear gas canisters from rooftop
Police throw gas canister at press, hit journalist in shin
Police charge protesters with bikes, discharge pepper spray
Police and National Guard use tear gas and LRAD to disperse protesters
desc: Protesters gathered outside the courthouse in Kenosha, rattling a fence erected that day. Police gave a dispersal order. Protesters did not disperse. Police then deployed tear gas and the LRAD alarm to disperse protesters.

title: LA Sheriffs tear gas protesters
Denver police arrest protester outside homeless encampment, fire impact munitions at others
desc:
Denver police have been routinely sweeping homeless encampments and displacing individuals staying in the park. Members of the community have gathered to protest and give aid, and NLG members often attend to observe.

On August 26th, police attempted to arrest an individual distributing food and aid. Other protesters intervened, pulling the individual away. Police then fired impact munitions at close range. They then tackled and arrested the individual and several others.

title: Police shove protesters, mace journalist, arrest drivers and damage cars
desc:
A journalist, Omari Salisbury, was livestreaming a protest in Seattle. About 5:30 into his livestream, he explains that police intend to push protesters back so they can remove vehicles in the street. Police begin shouting, "Move back," and shove protesters back. Police then mace protesters, as well as the journalist.

Police then push protesters back past the cars, slamming one protester into a car (6:08).

Around 7:20, police make an arrest.

Around 8:00, the streamer pans to police breaking the window of a car. Police then arrest the driver of that car.

title: Police grab umbrellas from protesters, then escalate force
desc:
Police and protesters face off at North Michigan Avenue and East Wacker Drive. Police rip umbrellas away from protesters. Police then begin shoving protesters, before striking them with batons and allegedly discharging pepper spray. Police additionally pepper sprayed protesters.

An alternate angle provided by the Chicago Police Department, shows police initiating violence in the top left of the video at 0:52.

title: Police shove and pepper spray protesters
desc: Police charge into a crowd of protesters at the intersection of North Dearborn and West Washington Streets. One protester falls and police surround them. Other protesters attempt to help the protester up and are pepper sprayed.

title: Police shove through protesters to make targeted arrest
desc: Footage shows police walking protesters down the street at North Dearborn and West Randolph Streets. Police begin shoving their way through protesters after a white-shirted officer points out a protester. Officers take the protester to the ground and arrest her, shoving the crowd back.

title: Protest marshal abducted by officers in unmarked van
desc: A protest marshal was singled out and arrested with charges of "Obstructing Highways and Other Public Passages." He was arrested while on the sidewalk when plainclothes officers emerged from an unmarked van, grabbed him, and drove away.

title: Police slash tires of bystander vehicle
Police charge protesters with shields
Police shove and strike protesters
Protest marshal abducted by officers in unmarked van
Officer shoves protester to the ground
Legal observer shoved to the ground
desc: During a standoff between police and protesters, several legal observers stand around near police. A firework, ostensibly thrown by protesters, explodes behind the police line. An officer then shoves a legal observer over.

title: Police throw stun grenade at retreating protesters
desc: Footage shows protesters walking away from police. An officer throws a stun grenade, which explodes at the protesters' feet.

title: Police charge protesters without warning
Police tackle protester, confiscate shield, then pepper spray her
desc: Footage shows a protester running by police. She is tackled to the ground and an officer strips away her shield. She stands and confronts the officer. Officer shove her away and pepper spray her.

title: Woman shoved to the ground
Police shove protesters following directions
desc: While moving protesters down the street, police can be seen shoving protesters and medics complying with directions.  In addition, one protester dropped a phone when shoved, then was struck and pepper sprayed when he attempted to retrieve it.

title: Police pepper spray protesters as they push protest into park
desc: A protest in Pittsburgh faced off with police when protesters stood at the edge of a sidewalk, while police stood in the road. Police then pushed protesters from the sidewalk into the park. Protesters passively resisted the shoving and were pepper sprayed.

title: Police shove press and legal observers, then release tear gas
Journalist struck with tear gas canister and impact munitions
desc: An independent journalist wearing a press badge around her neck is seen filming protests in the street. She then runs back after an explosive device strikes her in the ankle and is shot in the hip while running.

title: Police arrest protester on private property and shove others
Police shove protesters
desc: During dispersal at a protest, police walk protesters backwards. Protesters obey. Police shove protesters moving slowly, and shove them and protesters helping them as they try to stand.

title: Officer shoves members of the press
Police pepper spray a protester attempting to help another up
desc: A protester falls to the ground during a police advance. Another protester runs to help them up. Police pepper spray both of them.

title: Officer shoots protester at point blank range
desc: After protests at Terry Schrunk plaza are declared an unlawful assembly, police and DHS officers clear the park. A protester is kneeling in a brick area alone, with his hands on his head. An officer standing next to him shoots him with an impact munition. Another officer shoves the protester over.

title: Police repeatedly shove protester
Police confiscate speaker, then pepper spray owner
desc: At a protest late on August 23rd or early on the 24th, police confiscate a speaker from a protester, [@ProtestSound](https://twitter.com/ProtestSound). The protester does not release the speaker so police pepper spray them.

title: Police arrest protester without warning or clear justification
Police throw stun grenade at independent journalist
desc: An independent journalist films police from the sidewalk as they emerge from a building. A projectile is seen flying towards her and explodes before it lands. She does not appear to be standing near any other members of the press or protesters.

title: Police pepper spray protester with megaphone
Police shove and strike protesters
desc: In an incident that appears to occur in the background of il-chicago-22, a protester is punched by an officer. Other protesters begin to back away. Officers throw one protester to the ground. Another officer uses his bike to shove protesters against the wall of a building. The protester thrown to the ground is then beaten by an officer with a baton.

title: Police grab umbrellas from protesters, then escalate force
Reporter covering Proud Boys arrested
Officer shoves press
Police charge protesters without warning
desc: Footage shows police and protesters separated from one another after police declared a riot. Without warning, police begin chanting, "Move," and charge at protesters on foot and on bike. One officer on a bike runs over a protester. Officers then use their bikes to advance against protesters.

title: Police slash the tires of vehicles supporting protesters
desc: Police officers charge at protesters. A white pickup truck rolls along slowly with protesters. Police puncture the truck's tires.

title: Police slash the tires of vehicles supporting protesters
Woman shoved to the ground
desc:
An officer shoves a journalist from behind in the head with a baton. She falls to the ground and sits up. The officer strikes her in the head again.

This incident ocurrs directly after or-portland-289 and the events of that incident can be seen in this footage.

The woman who was hit in the head, Terri Jacobs, is now suing the city of Portland and the police bureau.

title: Police beat protester crawling on the ground
Police charge and tackle protesters

desc: Legal observers and press are documenting the arrest of a journalist on the sidewalk, several feet away from the incident. An officer approaches and shoves members of the press back. He then releases a tear gas canister at their feet.

title: Police respond to vandalism with tear gas and stun grenades
Journalist struck with explosive projectile
desc: Officers fire tear gas and impact munitions at protesters outside an ICE facility in SW Portland. A photojournalist is filming from the sidewalk when an explosive projectile ricochets and strikes them in the head and hands, knocking the camera out of their hand.

title: Journalist struck with explosive projectile
Police violently respond to vandalism
desc:
After protesters broke a few police vehicle windows, police gave a dispersal order and fired smoke and stun grenades. Police then dispersed protesters violently, striking several with batons and punching others.

One protester is punched repeatedly by an officer while being arrested before a second officer tells the first to stop.

title: Police shove protesters
Officer shoots protester at point blank range
Police shove legal observer
desc: A legal observer is seen talking to police, about events happening behind the police line. The officer shoves the legal observer. The observer then steps forward again and is thrown to the ground.

title: Police shove protesters on the sidewalk
desc: Police disperse protesters on the sidewalk. Protesters walk in the direction stated by police. Police threaten to arrest protesters who linger. Protesters at the back of the group are pushed and shoved. One is shoved to the ground and harassed again as they attempt to stand.

title: Police tear gas protesters
Police fire tear gas and impact munitions at protesters outside a precinct
desc: At protests following the death of Jacob Blake, protesters gathered outside a Kenosha police precinct. Protesters threw water bottles and shot of fireworks. Police responded with tear gas and impact munitions.

title: Police confiscate speaker, then pepper spray owner
Police charge protesters with bikes, discharge pepper spray
desc:
After protesters allegedly attempted to light something on fire or lowered a flag to the ground, police on bikes charged protesters, knocking several down. Police then discharged pepper spray at protesters.

One individual beaten by police was taken away on a stretcher.

In addition, Charlotte city councilman Braxton Winston was pepper sprayed during this incident.

title: Officer gropes and shoves woman, arrests protester trying to intervene
desc: Officers push protesters down the street. One protester turns to face officers. An officer squeezes one of her breasts, then the other, to push her away. Another individual, allegedly her boyfriend, tries to intervene and is shoved into the bushes then arrested. The woman is shoved down the street.

title: Police shove independent journalist
desc: Footage shows an officer walking a journalist filming from the sidewalk back. The officer then shoves the journalist to the ground.

title: Police throw stun grenade at independent journalist
Officer gropes and shoves woman, arrests protester trying to intervene
Police tear gas protesters a second night
Federal officers grab Riot Kitchen crew out of van and arrest them
Police pepper spray protesters
desc: While clearing protesters from the intersection at North Dearborn Street and West Randolph Street, police push through a crowd of protesters. The clip shows police pepper spraying protesters attempting to move away from police per instruction. Protesters are several feet from police and do not appear to be acting aggressively.

title: Officer shoots then clubs protester
desc: An officer fires at a protester at a distance of several feet (far closer then recommended). The protester then appears to say "Ah fuck you." The officer charges the protester and strikes them with his riot gun.

title: Police officer rips mask off protester, shoves reporter
desc: A journalist films as officers push through a line of protesters with shields. An officer grabs a protester, pins them against a wooden pole and rips their mask off. The officer then shoves the filmer, who is standing on the sidewalk.

title: Police shove through protesters to make targeted arrest

title: Legal observer shoved to the ground
Police on bicycles chase down and beat alleged protester
desc: Footage shows several officers on bikes chasing after an individual believed to be dispersing from a protest. One officer on foot slams the individual into a wall. Another officer dismounts and punches the individual repeatedly.

title: Police shove videographer
desc: A videographer on the sidewalk is shoved repeatedly by police, knocking their helmet off. The videographer is then shoved to the ground and the phone is swatted out of their hand. The videographer states they were prevented by police from retrieving their phone, which had fallen into the street. They state another individual later retrieved their phone.

title: Police respond to vandalism with tear gas and stun grenades
desc: After police declared a riot, protesters lit a mattress and other objects in the street on fire. Federal agents and Portland Police officers then deployed tear gas and stun grenades against the crowd, pushing them away from the ICE facility.

title: Police puncture the tires of the Snack Van a second night in a row
desc: The Snack Van, a protest vehicle offering free food, water and medical supplies to protesters, was driving slowly alongside protesters. Police charged the vehicle and punctured its tires.

title: Police puncture the tires of the Snack Van a second night in a row
Police shove protesters following directions
desc: After declaring an unlawful assembly and pushing protesters through the streets, Portland police moved onto the sidewalk, shoving protesters who were obeying directions.

title: Police shove protesters following directions
Officer shoves members of the press
desc: Police arrest a protester and press gather around to document. An officer shoves members of the press away. The journalists had allegedly been told minutes prior by another officer that their distance to the arrest was allowed.

title: Police break protester's phone
Police repeatedly shove protester
desc: A protester, who had allegedly been blinded by pepper spray and was having trouble getting their bearings, is shoved to the ground by police. Police then lift the protester off the ground and shove them forward again.

title: Police officer strikes journalist who insults him
desc: A member of the press is filming police from several feet away. He tells an officer to go fuck himself. The officer then swats the camera out of his hand.

title: Police drag protester, begin to arrest him, then release him
Police respond to vandalism and fireworks with tear gas
desc: At a protest outside the North Precinct in Portland, protesters built a barricade in the street and threw fireworks and other small objects at police. Police responded with tear gas and stun grenades. Officers then advanced into the street and made arrests.

title: Police respond to vandalism and fireworks with tear gas
Police pepper spray kettled protesters
desc: At an RNC protest in Charlotte, NC, police kettled protesters at College and 4th Streets shortly after midnight. Police then begin shouting "Move" and pepper spray protesters.

title: Police pepper spray protester with megaphone
desc: Police hold a line in Madison, Wisconsin. Several protesters mill about nearby. One stands near police, speaking into a megaphone. An officer pepper sprays this protester.

title: Police fire tear gas, pepper spray and impact munitions at protesters on the sidewalk
desc: A small group of protesters is clustered on a sidewalk. From across the street, police fire tear gas and impact munitions, believed to be sponge rounds. Police also discharge pepper spray.

title: Police tear gas protesters and make violent arrest
Police charge protesters with shields
desc: Police charge at a line of protesters with shields. Police use batons to strike protesters repeatedly, then make several arrests.

title: Officers shove and shoot Black Lives Matter protesters
desc:
At a dual protest between pro-Trump and Black Lives Matter protesters, BLM protesters entered the street and were confronted by police. This occurred after a member of the pro-Trump protest pepper sprayed BLM protesters.

Officers shoved protesters with batons, then an officer with a riot gun fired into the crowd from short distance. Justification is unclear. Regardless, the distance from which the officer fired the gun is against protocols.

title: Police violently respond to vandalism
Officers shove and shoot Black Lives Matter protesters
Police drag protester, begin to arrest him, then release him
desc: Police drag a man off the sidewalk into the street and lay him face down on the ground. Officers kneel on him as they arrest him. Officers then release him without explanation.

title: Police tear gas protesters
desc: Police and protesters faced off at a protest in Detroit, Michigan around midnight on August 22nd. Police deployed gas grenades, believed to be tear gas, and marched towards protesters. Police then struck protesters with batons and shields, arresting several.

title: Police pepper spray a protester attempting to help another up
Police fire tear gas and impact munitions at protesters outside a precinct
Police tear gas protesters a second night
desc:
Protesters were ordered to disperse from the court house. The crowd remained in front of the court house; protesters threw fireworks and water bottles at police. Police and National Guard deployed more tear gas and used the LRAD dispersal function; in addition, they shot protesters with impact munitions.

A student journalist from DePaul University was hit with a tear gas canister.

title: Police charge across the street, tackle, beat and arrest protester
desc: Footage shows police charging across the street at a protester who begins jogging away. Police tackle the protester to arrest them and can be seen repeatedly punching the protester to subdue them.

title: Police beat and arrest multiple protesters
desc: Footage shows police following dispersing protesters. One protester is shoved repeatedly and knocked to the ground. Another protester is dragged into a corner and arrested. A third talks to police and is singled out. An officer grabs them by the neck, while others grab the protester's body. The protester is knocked unconscious and falls to the ground. Officers then arrest the protester.

title: Police pepper spray kettled protesters
Police charge across the street, tackle, beat and arrest protester
Police fire tear gas, pepper spray and impact munitions at protesters on the sidewalk
Police arrest woman yelling at them
desc: A woman is seen yelling at police while police push protesters along the sidewalk. Although yelling, she is obeying police instruction. She says, after a while, "I don't listen to pigs." One officers then charges forward and grabs her to arrest her. Additional officers help make the arrest.

title: Protester hit by police car
desc:
A police cruiser peels away from a protest with lights and sirens on. The car takes a rapid turn around a corner and hits a protester crossing the street. The officer emerges from the car and stands over the woman while protesters gather around. The officer states he did not hit the protester.

The protester does not appear to be seriously injured.

title: Police and National Guard use tear gas and LRAD to disperse protesters
Officers trap protesters under bridge and shoot them
desc: Protesters in LA were trapped by police in the 3rd Street Tunnel. Police demanded that protesters relinquish their shields. As protesters began to do so, police fired on the crowd. Police then held protesters at the scene, allegedly allowing them to leave in small groups after being frisked.

title: Police shove member of the press
Police rip mask off detained protester and pepper spray them
desc: After a mattress was set on fire outside the Portland Police Association, police rushed protesters, making numerous arrests. In this footage, police can be seen ripping the mask off an immobile protester and macing them.

title: Police arrest, tear gas, pepper spray, and shoot protesters
desc: After police make an arrest at a protest, the protesters become agitated and shout at police. Police then throw tear gas canisters at protesters. Officers chase protesters down the street using tear gas, stun grenades and rubber bullets. One officer discharges pepper spray at protesters and the filmer, a journalist.

title: Police smash window and arrest Snack Van driver
Police punch arrestee
Police arrest journalist for 'disorderly conduct'
desc: A journalist is being walked away from a scene by a police officer. She tells the officer not to touch her and says, "I'm walking, you don't need to touch me. At this point, you're just showing all of us how little your dick is." The officer then arrests her for disorderly conduct.

title: Police arrest member of the press
Police tackle and arrest cyclist
desc:
A cyclist is seen riding away from the demonstration. Footage shows that he appears to be moving on to the grass. An officer in an unmarked vehicle then gets out of the car, chases the cyclist down then violently tackles and arrests him.

Additional footage shows that police then make several more arrests though the reasoning for them is unclear.

title: Police throw gas canister at press, hit journalist in shin
desc: As police prepare to ride away, some protesters throw objects at them. Police hurl a canister at journalists standing well away from these protesters, striking a journalist in the shin.

title: Police tear gas protesters and make violent arrest
desc: Police continuously fire tear gas at dispersing protesters. One protester in a parking lot is tackled to the ground by several officers and arrested.

title: Police pepper spray and tear gas protester
desc: Around 1 AM on August 25th, police arrest a protester on the Capitol building lawn. Other protesters approach the police line, appearing to stop several feet away. Police then pepper spray these protesters. Police then deployed tear gas shortly after.

title: Officer bludgeons protester with pepper spray can, then sprays crowd

desc: After a march ended at an ICE facility in Portland, protesters threw eggs and other small projectiles. Agents from FPS and DHS emerged to clear protesters with impact munitions and tear gas.

title: Officer knocks phone out of filmer's hand

desc: After declaring an unlawful assembly, police make several arrests. In this footage, police can be seen repeatedly punching a detained protester to subdue them.

title: Police shoot impact munitions into crowd

desc: A woman is seen filming protests. She gets into an altercation with an officer. The officer grabs her, then she shoves him away. The officer then pepper sprays her. She stated in an interview afterward that an officer grabbed her breast, so she pushed away; the officer then sprayed her.

title: Police shoot impact munitions at protesters
Police declare unlawful assembly, shoot pepper balls and tear gas
desc: After declaring an unlawful assembly and firing pepper balls for some time, Rochester PD tear gassed protesters. Protesters responded with fireworks.

title: Police charge protesters, knocking member of press to the ground
desc: After declaring an unlawful assembly, police charge protesters to disperse them. One journalist was caught in the charge and thrown to the ground.

desc: Multiple violent arrests were made by police after anti-ICE protesters blocked a street for about 20 minutes. In one incident (around 1:45 in the first link), an officer is pushing a protester backward toward the sidewalk. The protester is complying. A plainclothes officer then grabs the protester from behind and drags him away for arrest. A woman then pushes another officer involved in the arrest. The officer then yells, "Don't fucking touch me," and drags her from the sidewalk into the street. She is pulled face down on the ground while the plainclothes officer straddles her to arrest her.

title: DHS and Portland police work in conjunction to tear gas and arrest protesters
desc: After DHS agents pushed the protesters several blocks, protesters formed a line of homemade shields and umbrellas. ICE agents continued to fire tear gas and stun grenades, while Portland police charged the protesters, making several arrests.

title: Federal agents shoot pepper balls at protesters and bystand vehicle

desc: LA Sheriffs surround protesters and begin firing tear gas and impact munitions without warning. Protesters do not appear to be inciting violence or agitating in any way.

The filmer recovers what appears to be a foam bullet. The filmer then shows a protester attempting to pick up a spent tear gas canister; police shoot this protester repeatedly.

title: Police shoot at protesters in street

desc: A protester and an officer exchange words at close distance. The officer then pepper sprays the protester.

title: Police arrest, tear gas, pepper spray, and shoot protesters

Police snatch protesters standing among press on the sidewalk, throw them to the ground and arrest them. Other officers then shove press and legal observers away. Impact munitions can be heard fired; the filmer, a journalist, posted that police shot them in the feet.

Protesters can be seen milling about on the side of the road. Impact munition rounds can then be heard. One protester then runs up to a barricade, is shot repeatedly, and runs away. No justification for the burst of fire is clear.

The munitions are believed to be rubber bullets and/or pepper balls.
